participants: cross talk - a podcast about crosswords - listen on apple podcasts or spotify

messages.message:
Found a bug/feature type thing: When you get a link from a file on Instabase it does not create the spacing properly: example:
“https://www.instabase.com/ib_solutions/solutions/fs/Instabase Drive/poc/libor/resources/Contract Inventory Requirements_Consolidated_20190903_v2.xlsx”

The way around this is when you past it into chrome it will auto add: “https://www.instabase.com/ib_solutions/solutions/fs/Instabase%20Drive/poc/libor/resources/Contract%20Inventory%20Requirements_Consolidated_20190903_v2.xlsx”

*But you have to paste it into chrome first otherwise you can’t paste it into documents*
oh this is new right? I noticed yesterday that previously working links are now broken (probably since we pushed the last release?)
@Jessica @cross talk - a podcast about crosswords - listen on apple podcasts or spotify
I don’t remember having this happen before but no idea

messages.sender: cross talk - a podcast about crosswords - listen on apple podcasts or spotify
messages.message: “when you get a link from a file” -> what are the steps to repro this?
when i paste https://www.instabase.com/ib_solutions/solutions/fs/Instabase%2520Drive/.flow/ib/custom/us_markets/general.py into chrome, i get a error detail: mount point doesn't exist

messages.sender: cross talk - a podcast about crosswords - listen on apple podcasts or spotify
messages.message: err…can you make a ticket and i can check it out
Just go to anything that has the spacing and right click and gett the link like in the screenshot I posted
not sure if it's the same issue as matt, so i will make a separate ticket
oh wait, i just realiazed my link is messed up..
this is a personal problem lol
but yea i agree with the sentiment that let's just create tickets and let the team know to add to their weekly plan
oh i see, @cross talk - a podcast about crosswords - listen on apple podcasts or spotify matt is saying that the copy link button doesn't generate a url-encoded link
slack is a very confusing medium for this since i didn't immediately associate the image with his text (apologies)

This “bug” has been there for a long time :slightly_smiling_face: Technically it’s not really a bug as if you paste it into the browser it works - it’s just that if you paste it to a document or Slack it won’t get auto-styled as a clickable link. All we need to do is the `uriencode` it i believe
@lydia your bug looks like there’s an extra character encoded between “Instabase” and “Drive”. Space uriencoded is %20. I think you have an extra %25
